text:
To be honest, the thing that made me choose to study "Information Communication" is still unknown to me actually... It might seem strange for you to read this but the only thing I know for real is that I love foreign langages. Unfortunately, I wasn't really attracted by the studies we have in Paris around these foreign langages or around English especially, so I looked for something else that could inspire me.
As I know I won't enjoy at all working all alone in an office all day, I'd rather learn how to work in team and communicate with people in the best way possible to achieve something in which everything that could have been done has been done and with multiple points of view. I think that the more we are to create something, the more we'll be to understand.
Moreover, I'm a musician and organizing events with my music school is something I really like to do, it's actually my favorite thing about playing music. We all have a task when preparing the whole thing and then, sharing it with everyone once we're reunited and get on with it is something I love.
I think I'm thus getting into something because I have to and it seemed nice but initially, this wasn't the plan at all! My studies are mostly just a "Why not?". That's why I don't have much to say but for now, I'm not disappointed. Even if it's been just a week, I think that I may really enjoy it so I'm happy it turned out this way!
